q1.question: What is CustoTrack?
q1.answer: CustoTrack is a turnkey ERP & CRM solution designed for small businesses. It allows you to centralize your data, manage your operations, and automate certain tasks to save you time.

q2.question: How does the CRM setup work?
q2.answer: Our team configures and customizes your CRM based on your business needs. You don’t have to install anything — everything is ready to use from day one.

q3.question: What integrations are available?
q3.answer: CustoTrack adapts to your existing tools so you can keep working the way you already do. Our team can also set up custom integrations if needed.

q4.question: Is it secure?
q4.answer: Security and privacy are at the heart of our approach: your data is hosted in Europe and protected according to GDPR standards.

q5.question: What is the pricing?
q5.answer: Our pricing plans are designed to fit small businesses. Contact us for a personalized offer after your demo.

q6.question: How does a personalized demo work?
q6.answer: During the demo, we show you a version tailored to your business, answer your questions, and demonstrate how CustoTrack can simplify your daily operations.

about_page.story: CustoTrack was born in 2025 from a simple observation: traditional CRMs are often too complex, expensive, or underused by small businesses. We wanted to create a simpler, smarter, and more connected alternative that truly adapts to each company.

privacy_policy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy_policy.preamble: This Privacy Policy describes how CustoTrack collects, uses, retains, and protects your personal data when you visit our website, contact us, or request a product demonstration. We place the highest importance on respecting your privacy and process your data in compliance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679, the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), as well as applicable French legislation.
privacy_policy.scope: This Policy applies to all data processing carried out through our website and our contact or demo request forms. It does not cover processing by third-party services accessible via external links on our website, which are subject to their own privacy policies.
privacy_policy.controller: The data controller is CustoTrack, [LEGAL FORM TO BE COMPLETED], represented by Baptiste Prévost as legal representative. The registered office is located at [TO BE COMPLETED]. CustoTrack can be contacted at [TO BE COMPLETED] for any questions related to data protection. The SIREN/SIRET number, if applicable, will be added to this Policy as soon as it is issued.
privacy_policy.consent_and_legitimate_interest: By submitting a request through our forms or interacting with our website, you consent to the processing of the information you provide for the purpose of managing your request and organizing a personalized demonstration. Certain processing operations strictly necessary for the website’s operation and security are based on our legitimate interest, including technical logging, fraud prevention, and audience measurement (where applicable with your consent for non-essential cookies). You may withdraw your consent at any time for consent-based processing, without affecting the lawfulness of processing carried out before withdrawal.
privacy_policy.data_collected: We only collect the data strictly necessary to understand and follow up on your request. When you fill out a form, you provide your full name, professional email address, company name, and, if you choose, your phone number and additional project details. To ensure traceability, security, and quality of service, we also record technical information related to form submission, such as the date and time, the originating page, browser information (user agent), and your public IP address as transmitted by the routing service. This information is never used for purposes unrelated to processing your request, security, or measured service improvements.
privacy_policy.collection_methods: Data is collected directly from you when you fill out and submit a form on our website. Technical metadata for security and traceability purposes is collected automatically at the time of submission. Strictly necessary cookies may be placed on your device to ensure website functionality. Analytics cookies, if offered, are only activated after your explicit consent via the consent banner.
privacy_policy.purposes: The information you provide is used solely to understand your needs, organize and conduct a personalized demonstration of CustoTrack, answer your questions, document our exchanges, and, where appropriate, provide professional follow-up in a B2B context. Technical data associated with your request serves security purposes (fraud and spam prevention), internal traceability, and progressive improvement of our website’s usability and performance when audience measurement is activated with your consent.
privacy_policy.legal_basis: In accordance with Article 6 of the GDPR, processing operations are based, depending on the case, on your consent (forms, non-essential cookies) or on our legitimate interests (site security, technical logging, B2B communications, reasonable service improvement). When prior consent is required by law, we seek it explicitly and transparently. You may object at any time to processing based on legitimate interests for reasons relating to your particular situation, unless there are compelling legitimate grounds for continuing the processing.
privacy_policy.retention: We retain data submitted through forms for a maximum of three years from the date of your last contact with CustoTrack or the initial collection, unless you object earlier or longer retention is required by law. Technical logs used for security are kept for periods proportionate to their purpose. Analytics cookies, when activated, expire after no more than 13 months. After these periods, the data is either deleted or irreversibly anonymized.
privacy_policy.hosting_and_security: Our website is hosted in France by OVHcloud. Communications between your browser and our site are protected by TLS (HTTPS) encryption. Access to data is strictly limited to authorized personnel bound by confidentiality obligations, in accordance with the principle of least privilege. We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to prevent loss, alteration, or unauthorized access, and conduct regular checks and updates.
privacy_policy.processors_and_transfers: To route and organize your requests, we use service providers acting as processors under the GDPR. Information submitted through our forms is securely transmitted via Make (formerly Integromat) and organized in an Airtable database for lead tracking. These providers may process data outside the European Economic Area. In such cases, transfers are governed by appropriate safeguards, including the European Commission’s Standard Contractual Clauses and additional contractual security and confidentiality commitments. We ensure these processors act only on documented instructions, for strictly necessary purposes, and for limited durations.
privacy_policy.data_sharing: We do not sell or share your data with third parties for commercial purposes. Data is used exclusively internally by CustoTrack and its carefully selected technical processors for handling your request, organizing demonstrations, ensuring security, and maintenance. Outside of these cases, your information will only be shared to comply with legal obligations, respond to competent authorities, or assert our legal rights where necessary and proportionate.
privacy_policy.cookies: We use strictly necessary cookies to ensure the site functions correctly, including preference management (e.g., language settings and consent). Analytics cookies may be offered to help us understand site usage and improve usability; they are only placed with your explicit consent and can be refused without affecting access to essential content. You may manage your choices at any time through the consent banner or your browser settings.
privacy_policy.your_rights: You have, within the limits provided by law, the right to access, rectify, delete, restrict, object on legitimate grounds, and, where applicable, the right to data portability. To exercise these rights or ask any questions about data protection, you may contact us at: contact@custotrack.com. Proof of identity may be required in case of reasonable doubt to secure the process. We will respond within one month of receiving your request, extendable where legally permitted. You also have the right to lodge a complaint with the French data protection authority (CNIL) if you believe your rights are not respected.
privacy_policy.minors_and_professional_use: CustoTrack is designed for a professional audience. We do not knowingly solicit or store personal data of minors. If such data is inadvertently collected, it will be deleted as soon as it is identified.
privacy_policy.changes: We may update this Policy to reflect legal, technical, or operational changes. The date of the last update, shown at the top of the document, is binding. If significant changes affecting your rights or the nature of processing occur, we will notify you through appropriate means on our website.
privacy_policy.contact: For any questions regarding this Policy or to exercise your rights, you can contact CustoTrack at contact@custotrack.com or by post at [TO BE COMPLETED]. We are committed to processing your requests diligently, transparently, and in accordance with legal time limits.
privacy_policy.explanatory_clause: Example information clause: when you fill out a contact or demo request form on our site, we collect your name, professional email address, company name, and optionally your phone number and message content. We also log the submission date and time, referring page, public IP address, and browser information for security and traceability. This data is used solely to respond to your request, organize a demonstration, and ensure service security. The data is transmitted and stored by our technical providers Make and Airtable, which may operate outside the EU under adequate safeguards, including Standard Contractual Clauses. Your data is retained for no more than three years after your last contact and then deleted or anonymized. You may exercise your rights (access, rectification, deletion, objection, portability) at any time by contacting contact@custotrack.com.
